intro: Acrocarpidium brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed acrocarp, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features a compact growth habit with short, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, peppery scent. Acrocarpidium brevipes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks.
